result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla M. Clark
Current: 2859 Chestnut Drive, Apt 5, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 01-25-2017)
Prior: 2441 Vineyard Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla M. Clark
Current: 2441 Vineyard Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 03-16-2015)
Prior: 2725 Soo Marie Ave, Apt A, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

Defendant Kayla M. Clark in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard for sentencing: 14CF129, 14CF300, 14CM130  Status Conference - 14TR2772  Pre-Trial Conference - 14CF413

8:32 a.m.  Court calls the case.  

State moves to dismiss and read in 14TR2772 and 14CF413.
BY THE COURT:  14CF413 and 14TR2772 are dismissed and read-in. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court re: correction.
Atty Kryshak makes statements to the Court re: correction. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
14CF129 Count 7 - 
Serve 6 months jail. STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Agent can accept AODA already received if agent deems appropriate.
Sign releases so agent can review that assessment. 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain prescription medications. 
Sign releases so agent can monitor compliance to treating physician and pharmacy. 
Maintain fulltime employment if able or pursue high school diploma.  Pay restitution first before pursuing education.
Comply with any CHIPS order she is under. 
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent. If additional parenting classes are called for she is to do those. 
Pay restitution: $975.00 joint and several with Scott Jones. 
Pay DNA surcharge. 
Pay 10% restitution surcharge. 
No contact with Harold Drewa. 
No contact with Scott Jones except for the purpose of child placement or as approved by the agent. 
Pay costs. 
Provide DNA sample.  

14CF300 Count 1 - 
Serve 30 days jail. 
25 days credit. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Allowed to serve half the sentence on home monitor if she qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Pay $26.45 blood draw fee. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
Court does not order the DNA surcharge based on financial situation. 
Revocation for 12 months. 
IID for 12 months.  Effective immediately. 
Obtain DOT asesssment and comply with safety plan. 

14CF300 Count 3 - 
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to Count 1. 
Allowed to serve half the sentence on home monitor if she qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 
No additional revocation of the license. 

14CF300 Count 5 - 
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  STAYED
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent:
Same conditions as ordered in 14CF129. 
Pay costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 

14CM130 Count 1 - 
Serve 9 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence she is serving  STAYED
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent: 
Same conditions as ordered in 14CF129. 
Pay costs.  

14CM130 Count 3 - 
Serve 30 days jail, concurrent with 14CM130 Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence  STAYED
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent: 
Pay costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 

BY THE COURT: Any bond posted in any file is to be applied to the restitution/fines/costs.
Pre-trial conference on February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kayla M. Clark in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

3:21 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.


 Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prelim notice for 12/22
Not deliverable as addressed - Not at the address
Preliminary hearing on December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kryshak indicates his client is not here.  Was not here when the defendant had her initial appearance.  Asks for an adjournment to next Monday at 3:00. 
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla M. Clark
Current: 2725 Soo Marie Ave, Apt A, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 11-19-2014)
Prior: 2725 Soo Marie Ave Apt 14, Plover, WI 54467
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kayla M. Clark in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant indicates she did not receive a copy of the complaint. 
State hands a copy to the defendant. 
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates she spoke with her attorney but has to have him appointed.  Asks for the next hearing to be scheduled for the 24th. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADA  Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:29 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

PBT: .152
ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Misdemeanor and Felony Bailjumping .
Court reminds Defendant of her right to remain silent.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant wishes to not make a statement.
State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Defendant addresses the Court, cannot afford a $1,000 bond. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  November 10, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
Comply with bond conditions as stated in 14CF-129 and 14CF-130.
